project.title: Stone Block Column  - Substance Source Signature Collection
project.description:
I had a lot of fun making this substance. My approach was with a sculptural mindset, the idea, to make a column generator that could turn any cylinder into an ornate stone column. Once I had the basic parameters set up to control the shape I was able to have plenty of fun coming up with different profiles and patterns with which to decorate the columns. The various components of the column can be controlled and respond to each other automatically. Scaling one section repositions other elements to keep measurements and counts consistent. If you didn't want to use this substance to create columns the material outputs would also serve well for a trim sheet.

It is part of my Medieval themed Signature Collection for Substance Source which I had the pleasure of working on with the awesome people of the Substance Source team over at Adobe. I set myself a few goals for the set. The most important of which was thorough customisability of each material, I wanted each substance in the collection to have numerous parameters with variations of the main graph could easily be created to give the user a lot of flexibility to customise each material to the needs of their specific projects.

project.title: UE4.26 Volumetric Cloud and Real Time of Day
project.description:
This is a real-time lighting project, as there are so many amazing new tech in UE4.26, I decide to use this project as my lighting gym to help myself familiar with the latest real-time lighting tech with volumetric cloud 
Spending my Christmas holiday for some material study, went through Tyler Smith's tutorial for Northen light material.
And Michael Kinsey's tutorial for volumetric cloud creation
I use the Brushify Arctic pack as my environment base. and some 3D volume texture from the SOA Cloud creation pack.

Environment pack 
https://www.unrealengine.com/marketplace/en-US/product/brushify-arctic-pack
Michael Kinsey Volumetric cloud guide
https://www.artstation.com/marketplace/p/KzYA/dinusty-volumetric-clouds-in-ue4-tutorial-content
Tyler Smith Exp point tutorial
https://www.exp-points.com/marketplace-tyler-smith

project.title: The Girl With The Dragon Tattoo - Lisbeth Salander
project.description:
Here's my new personal project I've been working last couple of months on and off in my spare time, fanart of Lisbeth Salander from The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo. 
Sculpted in Zbrush, cloth was simulated in Marvelous Designer, lowpoly and UVs made in Maya and Rizom, baked in Marmoset, textured in Substance Painter, grooming done in Xgen and rendered in Unreal Engine. I also used texturing XYZ. for skin detailing.
Hope you like it :)

project.title: Cyberpunk 2077 - North Oak Designs
project.description:
Designs for the super rich north oak area, the one area in Night City where gardeners are constantly busy to make it so that plants can grow. North Oak residence use intricate neo-kitsch patterns in their grass that require a lot of money to maintain. Of course, this area is all about showing off to your neighbors :-) 

Art direction: Lucjan Więcek

project.title: Cyberpunk 2077 :: Life in Santo Domingo
project.description:
Here are some concepts I made for the subdistricts of Santo Domingo: Arroyo and Rancho Coronado. We made a lot of these kind of concepts throughout the development process, to figure out the locations, views, but also the lighting and cinematic events.  I really love Arroyo, one of my favorite districts, and an early idea was to have huge cargo AV's flying over with eyes on them. The second image is an early development shot of Rancho Coronado,  where I wanted to emphasize the contrast with the huge megabuildings. The third shot is a visualization of a cinematic event where the player runs into an ambush in Arroyo. 

Art director: Lucjan Więcek & Jakub Knapik
Credits to the environment and asset teams whose assets I could use for the third shot! 
The vehicle in the second shot was modeled by Paul Dalessi. 

instagram::
https://www.instagram.com/arthemart/

There might be more variations of some of this materials in the library, but those were done by Linus. I only showcase the ones done by me here.

project.title: Into the Wolf's Den- Castle Hall
project.description:
Into the Wolf's Den is a milestone project I did for school (Artside Game Art School), I imagined it as an adventure game which  involves boss fights (just as shadow of the colossus) and stealth phases.
You will control Umbrielle, a young woman who decided to flee from everyday's life frustrations by taking refuge in a world she created entirely. However as time goes by, the boundaries between this world and the real one are becoming tenuous
The game would be heavily based on the relationship she has with Tremor, a wolf who follows her everywhere and acts not only as a driving force but also as a brake for her.
I had a lot of fun working on this project, thanks to the Artside crew for their great guidance!

project.title: Wally's Bar - New Babbage
project.description:
Wally's Bar was introduced in Star Citizen's Alpha 3.9 update as part of the New Babbage interior release. 
Check out the break down here: https://www.artstation.com/artwork/kDo1yn

I worked on the center bar area designing many aspects and modeling everything with exception of the foliage and prop assets. I also worked on the prototype for the lighting set up for this space before the lighting department came in. The lighting feature walls that sport an Aurora like effect were also designed and implemented by myself and were really fun. 

Credit:
Art Direction by Ian Leyland
Art Lead: Nicholas Etheridge
Senior Environment artists: Josh Van Zuylen, Adam Sanders
Junior Environment artists: Fredrik Maribo, Alec Cornet, Tom Radford
Lighting Lead: Chris Campbell
Senior Lighting artist: Arther Yang
Concept art: Chris Doretz, Sheng Lam
 
© 2020 Cloud Imperium Rights LLC and Cloud Imperium Rights Ltd.

project.title: Golden Chest
project.description:
Hi everyone! Wanted to share with you this Golden Chest I worked on a few years back before getting involved with Godfall and the amazing team at Counterplay Games. It was a blast working on this asset! Budget was a bit tight and final polycount for this was 3,997 tris. Renders done in Unreal Engine 4. Hope you like it!

Concept by Counterplay Games.
